medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant pain with subjective fevers.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with soreness that gradually progressed to sharp pain, worsening over time. Initially, the patient was able to eat well and had normal bowel movements. The sharp pain became intolerable, leading to no oral intake despite normal bowel movements. Symptoms worsened over a week, presenting to the clinic with tachycardia and fever.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Aplastic anemia, multiple episodes of pulmonary embolism, chronic hepatitis B infection, gout, recurrent gastrointestinal bleeding, morbid obesity, hypertension, asthma, chronic venous stasis, colonic diverticulosis, osteoarthritis, mucinous adenocarcinoma (status post excision), chronic back pain, diabetes mellitus (steroid induced), chronic left ulnar neuropathy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with hypertension, coronary artery disease, myocardial infarction. Sister with ovarian cancer.
